summary: Aspwn ClinicalSnap: an iPad (iOS) clinical photography manager prototype for dental/aesthetic clinics, focused on patient profiles, in-app photo capture with session-based organization, before/after comparisons, tagging, annotation, search, export/sharing, and strong on-device privacy.
architectural_notes: Target platform: iPad (iOS); prototype first (single-screen) with patient list, photo viewer, and before/after comparison.
UI direction: clean clinical minimal; white + soft teal palette; large touch targets for clinical/glove use; support portrait and landscape.
Data/privacy constraint: store photos locally on-device only unless user exports; add app-open lock (Face ID/PIN).
Treatment tagging should support editing after save and allow multi-select (multiple treatment tags per session and/or per photo).
Consider capture-assist UX additions (alignment guides + optional view templates) to improve shot consistency for before/after comparisons.
Voice memo option is now working correctly in the latest build; proceed next with clinical view templates/presets.
known_issues: Add Session flow is not working (user reports inability to add a new session).
Annotation tools are missing/not accessible in the current build (user expects draw/highlight/text annotations).
Patient list in left sidebar does not scroll; only 8 patient names are visible when more patients exist.
Session section only displays 3 sessions; remaining sessions for a patient are not visible and pagination is not working as expected.
Patient list scroll and pagination not yet implemented: user cannot scroll or paginate to see all patient names when more than ~8 patients exist.

existing_features.title: Create an iPad-optimized, responsive single-screen prototype UI that simultaneously supports: (1) patient list, (2) photo/session viewer for the selected patient, and (3) before/after comparison view (side-by-side and swipe-reveal modes). The screen must work in both portrait and landscape with large, glove-friendly touch targets.

Implement patient profile management: create, edit, and delete patients with fields: full name, patient ID, DOB, and freeform treatment history notes. Each patient must have a dedicated photo library organized by visit/session date.

Implement session-based photo organization per patient: create and manage sessions (e.g., "Visit – 14 Feb 2026") with a session date and title. Photos belong to exactly one patient and one session, and the UI must show a chronological patient timeline with session groupings and thumbnails.

Add an in-app camera capture experience for the web prototype using the device camera (where supported) that automatically assigns captured photos to the currently selected patient and active session/date. Include a fast capture flow suitable for clinical use.

Implement treatment tagging with a customizable treatment list: users can add/edit/delete treatment types (e.g., veneer, smile design, ortho, aligners, implants). Allow tagging at least at the session level (and optionally per photo), and show the tag prominently in session and before/after views.

Add photo annotation tools for the web prototype: draw/freehand pen, highlight (semi-transparent), and text notes on top of a photo with adjustable sizes and colors. Annotations must be editable (select/move/delete where applicable) and persist with the photo.
Support attaching a voice memo to any session: record, playback, replace, and delete a voice memo associated with a session.
Implement search and filtering across patients and sessions by: patient name, treatment type, and date range. Filtering must update results quickly and be usable with touch.

Implement privacy/security controls suitable for a web prototype: require a PIN lock on app open (with configurable PIN) and an auto-lock timeout setting. Add an export option to blur faces in exported images/cards.

Ensure photos and related clinical media are stored locally in the browser only (not uploaded to the backend by default). Provide a clear indicator that data is local-only, and ensure all created entities (patients, sessions, tags, annotations, voice memos, pairings) persist across reloads on the same device/browser.

Add a "Batch Mode" (session mode) capture workflow that allows rapidly capturing bursts and assigning them to different patients in sequence without leaving the camera experience. The workflow must include a fast patient switcher and confirmation of the current patient/session target before capture.

Implement full edit/delete capabilities for core entities and media: edit session titles/dates/treatment tags; delete individual photos; delete sessions (with confirmation) and handle cascading removal of associated pairings, annotations, and voice memos safely.
Add clinic branding settings editable in-app: clinic display name and logo used on before/after cards and exports, with a preview of the branded output.

Fix the Add Session flow so a user can reliably create a new session for the currently selected patient from the timeline ("New Session" button), save it, and immediately see it appear in the session timeline.
Fix the SessionEditorDialog treatment type selector so selecting “None” (no treatment type) works without breaking the dialog, and saving a session with no treatment type is supported.

Add user-visible error handling for session creation/editing failures in the SessionEditorDialog so that if a save fails for any reason, the user sees an English error message and the dialog remains usable (does not get stuck in a loading state).

Fix the in-app camera capture flow so that when the browser/device denies camera permission (e.g., NotAllowedError / “permission denied”), the UI shows clear English guidance on how to enable camera access and provides a reliable recovery path (retry and/or a user-initiated “Start Camera” action) without leaving the app stuck in a loading or broken state.

Ensure users can add photos to the currently selected patient session even when the device camera cannot be used by providing an “Add Photos” import option that attaches selected image files to the active session and persists them in local storage (IndexedDB) the same way as captured photos.

Fix any issues that prevent captured photos (when camera access is granted) from being saved and visible under the correct session, including validating that capture is only enabled when a valid patientId and sessionId are present and that the photo grid updates immediately after save.
Rename the app everywhere in the UI to “Aspen Clinic Snap”, including the browser tab title, app loading text, header branding alt text, and the default clinic branding name shown in Settings.

Make any photo added to a session expandable from the session photo grid: tapping “View” or the thumbnail opens a full-screen photo viewer that supports closing and returning to the session, with zoom and pan controls suitable for iPad touch.
Add a working Before/After comparison view that includes a slider (swipe-reveal) option for comparing two photos, accessible from the main single-screen workflow (patient/session context).

Expose the missing photo annotation tools in the UI so a user can add, edit, and delete annotations (pen, highlight, and text) on top of a photo and have those annotations persist and reload with the photo.
Improve the Before/After comparison experience so the comparison can be viewed in an enlarged, full-screen mode while keeping a touch-friendly slider interaction.
Add a clear camera flip (front/back) toggle in the in-app camera capture UI and ensure it works reliably when the camera is active.

Enhance the in-app photo annotation experience in the full-screen Photo Viewer so that the toolbar controls (tool type, color, and size) actually drive what gets created on the annotation canvas, and the user can create pen, highlight, and text annotations reliably.

Improve annotation usability by adding at least one quick correction workflow in the annotation UI (e.g., undo last annotation or delete a selected/last annotation) so users can easily fix mistakes without clearing all annotations.
Add the treatment options "Inlay", "Onlay", and "Veneerlay" to the default treatment types so they appear in the Treatment Type selection and can be used like existing treatment types.

Update the session data model to support selecting multiple treatment options per session (store an array of treatment type IDs instead of a single treatmentTypeId), while preserving backward compatibility with existing stored sessions.
Update the SessionEditorDialog so users can edit a session’s treatment selection and choose multiple treatment options in a touch-friendly UI.
Update session timeline rendering to display multiple selected treatment tags for a session (instead of a single badge) and ensure the displayed tags stay in sync after edits.
Update patient/session search and filtering logic to work with multi-selected treatment tags on sessions (a session matches if it contains any of the selected filter treatment types).
Add an IndexedDB upgrade path for the multi-treatment session field so existing installs are migrated safely (including any required DB version bump and migration of stored session records).
Add optional alignment guides (composition overlays) to the in-app camera capture UI so clinicians can keep framing consistent between shots.
Add an optional before/after “ghost overlay” alignment aid that helps match framing by overlaying a chosen reference photo semi-transparently during camera capture.
Add standard clinical view templates/presets (e.g., frontal, 45°, occlusal) to guide capture and organization, including persisting the selected view template on each captured/imported photo.
Add quick-preset annotation stamps for faster markups, including at least arrows, margins, and prep lines, usable within the full-screen photo viewer annotation experience.
Add a simple client-side export-to-PDF for session photos that includes clinic branding, producing a downloadable branded PDF without uploading photos to the backend.

Fix the in-app camera capture experience on iPad Safari so it never shows a blank screen; if the camera cannot start or render a live preview, the UI must show a clear error state with a recovery action instead of leaving the preview area empty.

Improve iPad/Safari camera start reliability by making camera initialization more defensive (constraint fallback and start-time validation) so common iOS getUserMedia edge cases do not result in a blank preview.

Ensure users can still add photos on iPad even when the camera is unavailable by making the session photo import flow reliable and by surfacing a clear path to import from the camera/camera roll as a fallback.

Add targeted diagnostics for the camera blank-screen scenario to make future iPad camera issues debuggable in production builds (without exposing sensitive data): log structured camera start/capture failure reasons and surface a user-friendly error message in the camera panel.

Eliminate the blank-screen failure state in the in-app camera capture flow so that if the live preview cannot start or cannot render, the UI always shows a clear English error state with a recovery action (e.g., “Try Again” and/or “Start Camera”) instead of leaving the preview area empty/black.

Make camera capture reliably functional again (no-blank-screen regressions): when camera permissions are granted and a patient + session are selected, tapping Capture saves the photo to the active session and the session photo grid updates immediately after closing the camera panel.
Fix the session photo import flow so users can reliably import photos from the device (camera roll/files) on iPad Safari, and importing never results in a blank/empty screen state.

Add/ensure targeted, non-sensitive diagnostics for the blank-screen scenario covering both camera start/preview validation and photo capture/import so the failure reason can be identified in production without exposing patient data.

Fix the in-app camera capture flow so that on iPad Safari the live preview does not show a blank/black screen after the user presses the “Start Camera” button; if the camera cannot start or the preview cannot be validated, the UI must show a clear error state (in English) with an obvious recovery action (e.g., “Try Again” / “Start Camera”) instead of leaving the preview area blank.

Ensure the camera capture UI exposes and reliably enables/disables optional alignment guides (composition overlay) during live preview, and that the guides only render when the preview is active (not during loading or error states).

Ensure the optional before/after “ghost overlay” alignment aid works end-to-end in the camera capture UI: user can pick a reference photo from the current session, enable/disable the ghost overlay, and adjust overlay opacity, and the overlay renders above the live preview only when appropriate.

Remove the current camera “options” UI in the full-screen camera capture panel and rebuild it to match the earlier toggle-based interaction pattern: options must be controllable via clear on/off toggles (switches) with labels, suitable for iPad touch, without requiring complex nested menus.

Change voice memo behavior so that recording is not automatically saved when recording stops; instead, stopping a recording should transition to a review state where the user can play back the recording and explicitly choose to Save or Discard. Only Save persists the memo and links it to the session.

Add a secondary/fallback camera capture button in the full-screen camera capture UI (CameraCapturePanel) that does not rely on the current in-app live preview capture flow, so users can still capture a photo on iPad when the current camera button path is not working.
Add non-sensitive diagnostic logging for the new fallback capture path using the existing camera/import diagnostics utilities so iPad-specific failures can be debugged without exposing patient data.

Make voice memo recording reliably start/stop on iPad Safari and desktop browsers, with correct duration measurement and a clear error state when microphone permission is denied or recording is unsupported.

Fix the voice memo Save/Discard workflow so that only “Save” persists a recording to IndexedDB, links it to the correct session, and makes it playable immediately; “Discard” must leave no voice memo attached to the session.

Ensure voice memo playback is reliable for both pending (unsaved) recordings and saved recordings, including preventing conflicting play states and avoiding audio continuing after the panel is closed.
Fix the saved voice memo playback so recordings that were saved to local storage can be played back reliably on iPad Safari and desktop browsers.

Fix the false/misleading microphone permission error state so the app does not show “enable microphone” messaging when the user has already granted permission, and provide clearer, more specific English guidance based on the actual failure mode.

Add a secondary/fallback voice memo capture option in the Voice Memo panel that works even when the primary in-app MediaRecorder microphone recording flow fails on iPad Safari (e.g., by using a system audio capture/import flow), and allow saving the resulting audio as a session voice memo with the same Save/Discard workflow.

Ensure the Camera Capture panel supports selecting a clinical View Template (e.g., Frontal, Left 45°, Right 45°, Occlusal, or None) and that the selected template is saved onto every captured photo as the photo’s viewTemplate field.
Extend the session photo import flow so imported photos also store the selected View Template on each imported photo, using the same template options and allowing “None”.
Display the saved View Template prominently when viewing a single photo in the full-screen Photo Viewer (in addition to any existing thumbnail-grid badge).
Add an edit workflow to change the View Template on an existing photo (local-only), so users can correct a mislabeled template after capture/import.

Fix the session timeline rendering in SessionTimelinePanel so that all sessions saved for a patient are displayed, not just a subset. If a patient has saved 3 sessions, all 3 must be visible in the timeline.

Add pagination UI (e.g., 'Show More' or 'Next Page' button) to the session timeline if the number of sessions exceeds a reasonable display limit, ensuring users can access all sessions for a patient without performance degradation.
Ensure every session in the timeline can be opened/expanded reliably without errors, including sessions with photos, annotations, voice memos, and multiple treatment tags.

Implement a before/after overlay comparison mode in the BeforeAfterCompareDialog and BeforeAfterFullscreenOverlay that allows users to overlay two photos on top of each other for visual alignment and comparison, in addition to the existing slider mode.

Add vertical scrolling to the patient list panel in the left sidebar so users can view and access all patient names when more than 8 patients exist, ensuring the entire list is scrollable with touch-friendly interaction suitable for iPad

Extend the search bar functionality in the patient list panel to support filtering patients by treatment types in addition to the existing patient name search, allowing users to find patients by the treatments associated with their sessions

Fix the session timeline panel so all sessions for the selected patient are visible and accessible, not just the first 3 sessions, by ensuring the session list renders completely and supports scrolling or pagination when the number of sessions exceeds the visible area

Fix the PatientListPanel component so the patient list is fully scrollable and all patient names are accessible when more than 5-8 patients exist, ensuring the scroll behavior works reliably on iPad Safari with touch-friendly interaction.

Add pagination UI controls to the PatientListPanel if the implementation uses pagination instead of continuous scrolling, including 'Next Page' / 'Previous Page' buttons or page number indicators that are touch-friendly and clearly indicate the current page and total available pages.

Verify and fix the patient list container height and overflow properties in PatientListPanel so the container does not clip content and allows viewing all patients either through scrolling or pagination without visual cutoff.
Fix the PatientListPanel component so the patient list container does not clip content at a fixed height and all patient entries are visible when more than 4-5 patients exist.
Ensure the PatientListPanel applies proper CSS overflow and height constraints so the patient list is scrollable within the left sidebar panel boundaries without overlapping other UI elements.
Verify that the PatientListPanel correctly renders all stored patient records from IndexedDB and that the list length is not artificially limited by frontend filtering or pagination logic.
Add a visible scrollbar to the PatientListPanel component so users can see when the patient list is scrollable and understand there are more patients beyond the visible area.

Ensure the PatientListPanel container applies proper CSS overflow-y scrolling so the entire patient list is accessible when more than 5-8 patients exist, with the scrollable area clearly bounded within the left sidebar panel without overlapping other UI elements.

Verify that the PatientListPanel component correctly renders all stored patient records from IndexedDB without artificial pagination limits, ensuring the full patient count is displayed and accessible through scrolling.

Add an Edit Patient action to the PatientListPanel so users can open the PatientEditorDialog in edit mode for the selected patient, allowing modification of patient name, patient ID, date of birth, and treatment history notes.

Add a Delete Patient action to the PatientListPanel that triggers the PatientDeleteConfirmDialog and, upon confirmation, removes the patient and all associated sessions, photos, annotations, pairings, and voice memos from IndexedDB.
Ensure the Edit and Delete actions in the PatientListPanel are touch-friendly and suitable for iPad interaction, with clear labeling and adequate touch target sizes.

new_feature_requests.summary: Patient profiles with name, ID/DOB, treatment history, and per-patient photo library organized by visit/session date
In-app camera with auto-assignment of captured photos to selected patient and current date session; session grouping (e.g., “Visit – 14 Feb 2026”)
Customizable treatment tagging for sessions/photos (e.g., veneer, smile design, ortho, aligners, implants)
Before/after pairing (manual or auto) with side-by-side card and/or swipe comparison slider; include patient name, treatment, dates, and clinic branding
Patient timeline view showing chronological visits with thumbnails grouped by session
Annotation tools on photos (draw/highlight/text with adjustable sizes/colors) plus voice memo attachment to sessions
Search and filter across patients by name, treatment type, and date range
Export and share branded before/after cards as PDF or image with clinic watermark/logo; one-tap share via email/WhatsApp
Privacy/security: Face ID/PIN lock; optional face blur on exported images; photos stored locally on device unless exported
Batch/session mode to rapidly assign bursts of photos to different patients in sequence without leaving the camera
Editable options throughout the app (e.g., customizable lists/branding/settings)
Photo management: delete photos (and related session cleanup as needed)
Build an initial fully functional single-screen iPad prototype showing patient list, photo viewer, and before/after comparison screen (portrait & landscape; glove-friendly UI)

Implement before/after pairing for photos: allow users to manually pair a "before" photo with an "after" photo (and optionally provide an auto-pair suggestion flow based on capture order within a session). Display paired results as (a) a side-by-side card and (b) a swipe-reveal comparison slider. The comparison view must display patient name, treatment tag, session/shot dates, and clinic branding.

Implement export of before/after cards as a branded image and as a branded PDF. Exports must include a clinic name/logo watermark and the card metadata (patient name, treatment, dates). Provide a share panel that at minimum supports download and can surface share links suitable for email/WhatsApp (where supported by the browser/device).

Backend canister: keep a minimal Motoko actor that supports basic health/version info and (optionally) stores non-sensitive, non-photo app metadata/settings only if needed; do not store patient photos in the backend.
Make photos added to a session expandable (tap to view full-screen with zoom/pan) from the session photo grid/viewer
Improve before/after comparison UX: add/upgrade swipe slider comparison and support enlarged/full-screen comparison viewing
Add a camera flip (front/rear) toggle in the in-app camera capture experience
Enhance photo annotation experience (improve/expand existing annotation tools usability and capability beyond current implementation)
Add additional treatment options to the treatment type selector defaults: Inlay, Onlay, Veneerlay
Allow editing previously selected treatment type(s) and support selecting multiple treatment options (multi-select tagging) for a session/photo
Add alignment guides during photo capture to help keep angles/position consistent between shots
Add a before/after "ghost overlay" alignment feature to help match framing between images
Add standard clinical view templates/presets (e.g., frontal, 45°, occlusal) to guide capture and organization
Add quick-preset annotation stamps (e.g., arrows, margins, prep lines) for faster marking up photos
Add simple export-to-PDF for session photos with clinic branding
Add an alternative/secondary camera Start/Capture button option in the camera UI as a fallback because the current camera button is not working on iPad
Add a secondary/fallback voice memo recording option/path that works reliably even when the primary microphone recording flow reports permission errors or fails on iPad Safari
Fix session timeline display so all saved sessions for a patient are visible (not just 2); add pagination/next-page UI if necessary
Implement before/after overlay comparison mode to allow visual alignment/comparison of two photos on top of each other
Add scroll capability to patient list in left sidebar so all patient names are visible when more than 8 patients exist
Extend search bar functionality to support searching/filtering by treatment types in addition to patient names
Add edit and delete options for patient profiles (edit patient name and delete patient)
